content.question: ​The \(Na^+/K^+\) pump requires ATP to move the ions from one side of a membrane to the other. Which of the following explains the role ATP plays in the pump’s activity?​

choices.label: ATP provides energy for the ions to move down the concentration gradient.
​ATP adds a phosphate to the \(K^+\) ion so that it is not charged and can be moved by the pump.   ​
ATP provides energy for the ions to move against the concentration gradient.
​ATP adds a phosphate to the \(Na^+\) ion so that it is not charged and can be moved by the pump.   ​

content.answer: ATP provides energy for the ions to move against the concentration gradient.
